title: Child among 4 shot at southwest Houston apartment complex
content:
HOUSTON - A young child was among four people shot, one fatally, at an apartment complex in southwest Houston, police said Sunday.
The shooting happened in the 6000 block of Elm Street around 6:35 p.m.
One victim, a 40-year-old male, died at the scene.
Police said three other victims, a 21-year-old male, a 19-year-old female and a 3-year-old boy were transported to area hospitals with non-life threatening injuries.
Police at the scene said a bullet grazed the boy’s head.
The shooting happened near the pool area of the apartment complex. Witnesses told KHOU 11 News they heard people arguing before the shots rang out.
"We were here in the apartments and everybody panicked and wanted to see what was going on because you never know if it's going to be a little kid..." said one resident at the complex.
Homicide detectives were on the scene Sunday evening. So far, police have no leads on the suspects or a possible motive.
Anyone with additional information is urged to contact the HPD Homicide Division at 713-308-3600 or Crime Stoppers at 713-222-TIPS.
